SENT.plain: The outcome of continued EPO therapy was studied in 18 responding MDS patients
The EPO dose was reduced in a stepwise fashion to find the lowest possible maintenance dose
Relapses of anemia were associated with either progressive disease or reduction of the administered EPO dose
In the latter group second responses to renewed EPO therapy were readily achieved
Long-term responses were seen in about a third of the patients
Thus, it seems safe to reduce the EPO dose among responding patients
This approach may have advantages both from a medical and a socio-economic perspective
